St. John's and Maryland are the only obstacles in Johnny Hopkins' road to the State Championship. An attempt to remove the
first is to be made tomorrow and a difficult task is in store for the
team. It is necessary that every undergraduate chant the annual
and traditional slogan "Beat St. John's".

HOPKINS GRADUATES ELECTED
It would be ridiculous and presumptuous for the News-Letter to
*attempt to compete with large and well-organized dailies in the dissemination. of news of the outside world. It is for this reason that
we confine ourselves, as a general rule, to campus news and campus
activities. Now and then, however, matters of interest to Hopkins
men occur off of the campus and we are forced to raise our heads over
the surrounding wall and take cognizance of the doings of the world
at large.
It is of more than passing interest to note that two former Hopkins undergraduates were victorious by large majorities in the recent election. Governor Albert C. Ritchie, A.B., '96, had the honor
to be the first man to be re-elected to the office of Governor of the
State of Maryland. The Honorable Eli Frank, A.B.,'93, was chosen
by the city of Baltimore as Judge of the Supreme Bench.
The News-Letter, in the name of Hopkins, extends to these two
sons heartiest congratulations and best wishes for a successful term.

team. It is necessary that every undergraduate chant the annual

HOPKINS GRADUATES ELECTED
It would be ridiculous and presumptuous for the News-Letter to
*attempt to compete with large and well-organized dailies in the dissemination. of news of the outside world. It is for this reason that
we confine ourselves, as a general rule, to campus news and campus
activities. Now and then, however, matters of interest to Hopkins
men occur off of the campus and we are forced to raise our heads over
the surrounding wall and take cognizance of the doings of the world
at large.
It is of more than passing interest to note that two former Hopkins undergraduates were victorious by large majorities in the recent election. Governor Albert C. Ritchie, A.B., '96, had the honor
to be the first man to be re-elected to the office of Governor of the
State of Maryland. The Honorable Eli Frank, A.B.,'93, was chosen
by the city of Baltimore as Judge of the Supreme Bench.
The News-Letter, in the name of Hopkins, extends to these two
sons heartiest congratulations and best wishes for a successful term.
